symbolDefinition.name: Asterisk
symbolDefinition.description: zero or more phones or diacritics

symbolDefinition.name: Plus sign
symbolDefinition.description: one or more phones or diacritics

symbolDefinition.name: Lower-case L
symbolDefinition.description: voiced dental or alveolar lateral approximant

symbolDefinition.name: OBSOLETE IPA - Replaced with labialized z or ð
symbolDefinition.usage: OBSOLETE IPA - Replaced with labialized z or ð

symbolDefinition.name: Left-hook T
symbolDefinition.description: palatalized voiceless dental or alveolar plosive

symbolDefinition.name: Hooktop heng
symbolDefinition.description: simultaneous voiceless postalveolar and velar fricative

symbolDefinition.name: L with tilde
symbolDefinition.description: velarized or pharyngealized voiced dental or alveolar lateral approximant

symbolDefinition.name: Belted L
symbolDefinition.description: voiceless dental or alveolar lateral fricative

symbolDefinition.name: L-Ezh ligature
symbolDefinition.description: voiced dental or alveolar lateral fricative

symbolDefinition.name: Long-leg R
symbolDefinition.description: voiced alveolar fricative trill (that is, ř in the Czech orthography)

symbolDefinition.name: Reversed fish-hook R
symbolDefinition.description: apical dental unrounded syllabic alveolar fricative (vowel)

symbolDefinition.name: Reversed fish-hook R with tail
symbolDefinition.description: apical retroflex unrounded syllabic alveolar fricative (vowel)

symbolDefinition.name: Curvy turned H
symbolDefinition.description: apical dental rounded syllabic alveolar fricative (vowel)

symbolDefinition.name: Right-tail curvy turned H
symbolDefinition.description: apical dental rounded syllabic retroflex fricative (vowel)

symbolDefinition.name: Superscript hooktop H
symbolDefinition.usage: To indicate that a plosive is breathy voiced, use 405

symbolDefinition.name: Under-dot
symbolDefinition.usage: Use 429 (1989). However, comonly used in transliteration of Indic and Dravidian languages to indicate retroflex articulation.

symbolDefinition.name: Alpha
symbolDefinition.usage: Reference Phonetic Symbol Guide (2nd edition, pg. 8)

symbolDefinition.name: Small capital A
symbolDefinition.usage: Used by phoneticians in China Replaced with U+00E4

otherwise.title: voiced bilabial plosive with nasal release
voiced velar plosive with nasal release
voiced retroflex plosive with nasal release

symbolDefinition.name: Grave plus acute plus grave accent
Acute plus grave plus acute accent

otherwise.title: voiced alveolar plosive with nasal release

sequencePattern.title: double closure: plosive + implosive means implosive
prenasalized double closure: nasal + plosive + plosive
prenasalized double closure: nasal + nasal + plosive + plosive
plosive + click indicates voicing and dorsal place.
nasal + click indicates voicing, nasality, and dorsal place.

descriptionChange.title: For glottal or epiglottal plosive, voiceless is omitted.
For velar, replace advanced with fronted.
For velar, replace retracted with back.
For click, replace postalveolar with palatoalveolar.
Name of click does not include velar (but does include uvular) place of articulation.
In place of articulation pairs, replace bilabial with labial, except for click.
For consonant, replace rounded with labial.
For any vowel, voiced is omitted.
If a vowel has a more specific rounding feature, rounded is redundant.
Insert with preceding advanced/retracted tongue root.
